answers.answer: you are dehydrated plan and simple.  You need more water in the winter time than any other time of the year.  Make sure you are urinating clear  or a very light color. This should help a lot.

In addition, apply petroleum jelly (Vaseline is a brand name.) to your lips before you go to bed.  I've had this problem for a few years, so I know it's not simple dehydration, since I myself drink water like there's no tomorrow.  Drinking more water is always good, though, since most people don't drink enough.

Two thoughts, first I agree with previous poster that you should apply a Vaseline type of chap-stick to your lips at night. Chances are your a nighttime mouth breather (as opposed to nose breathing).  That also makes me think you might have allergies. If you do have allergies and you take an antihistamine, that can contribute to your dry lips.  Bottom line is keep your lips moist with chap-stick at night and it should be fine.

You are dehydrated my mom had the same problem and she would drink water daily and it would still occur so I started giving her a Gatorade or power are and it would clear up almost instantly although she was drinking water it was not replacing her electrolytes that. She was loosing. A few months later we found out that the cause of her dehydration was diabetes I hope this help.

title: LIPS PEELING AT NIGHT
